com.m3rcuriel.controve.api

Class Conductor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.m3rcuriel.controve.api.Conductor

  • public final class Conductor
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to invoke registered Executables on a fixed period using a metronome.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Conductor(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Iterable<Executable> executables, Clock timeSystem, Metronome metronome, java.util.function.LongConsumer delayInformer) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void start()
      Start the execution of the Conductor in a seperate thread.
      void stop()
      Stop this conductor from executing, and block until the thread has completed all work (or the timeout occurs).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Conductor

        public Conductor(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.Iterable<Executable> executables,
                 Clock timeSystem,
                 Metronome metronome,
                 java.util.function.LongConsumer delayInformer)

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the execution of the Conductor in a seperate thread. During each loop, all registered Executables will be called in the order that they were registered.

        Calling this method when already started does nothing.

        See Also:
        stop()

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop this conductor from executing, and block until the thread has completed all work (or the timeout occurs).

        Calling this method while already stopped has no effect.
